info.description:
# py-aws-certr

A Python package for creating Amazon Certificate Manager (ACM) certificates for domains in Route 53.

## Features

- Will recognise when ACM requires domain ownership to be verified, and will create the relevant domain records for you.
- Waits until the certificate is issued and ready to use.
- Idempotent.
  - Running a second time will not create a duplicate certificate.
  - If the execution times-out because AWS took too long to issue the certificate then just run again with the same parameters and wait some more.

## CI status

[![CircleCI](https://circleci.com/gh/cariad/py-aws-certr/tree/master.svg?style=svg)](https://circleci.com/gh/cariad/py-aws-certr/tree/master)

## Installation

```shell
pip install awscertr
```

## Command-line usage

```shell
python request.py --domain yourdomain.com  \
                 [--include-subdomains   ] \
                 [--region REGION        ]
```

### Code usage

```python
import awscertr

cert_arn = awscertr.request(domain='yourdomain.com',
                            include_subdomain=True,
                            region='us-east-1')
```

## Development

### Installing development dependencies

```shell
pip install -e .[dev]
```

### Running tests

```shell
python test.py
```
